content:
Summary

Merge the tymethod and method URL fragments into just method.

Why?

They add needless complexity to the intra-doc links code (e.g., whether an associated item is an impl vs a prototype has to be hardcoded in some circumstances) and elsewhere in rustdoc. I don't think there's any need to distinguish between these two kinds. For example, associated constant prototypes in traits vs definitions in traits, trait impls, and inherent impls both use associatedconstant.

Drawbacks

  • It could cause slightly more fragment conflicts. Those should be solved by "semantic ID disambiguation" (#92052). I think it's unlikely that this merger would cause significantly more conflicts, though.
This is a good idea. Thanks for proposing it.
Does anyone have concerns about this? Otherwise, I'd like to go ahead and implement it.
I think it's fine. I came across it a few times so I'm happy to see I'm not the only one having an issue with it. It'll allow us to remove CSS, which is great.

@Noah Lev I can't find where you mentioned it, but the links under (e.g.) "Structs" in your branch are not getting colors, because the CSS rule for colors is .content a.struct. Normally everything is a child of <section id="main-content" class="content"> but that seems to not be the case when I build your branch. I'm not aware of something on master that changed recently that would cause that to happen, but I'll take a quick look.
replied on PR - there are some small changes to when tags get closed that might produce the problem you noted
